In the interest of well being of people, it is urged that people use 360 degree feedback, pigeon hole and my voice comments to get issues addressed. It is not sensible to malign reputation of DBS on glassdoor. If you think you are being unheard by HRBP and various forums, reach out to CEO for inputs and help.
Con: None that I have witnessed in last decade.

Title: Great Company
Pro:
1. Bank believes strongly in talent rotation. Priority is given to internal staff to apply for transfer.
2. Good leaders and top management who are capable of steering the company to greater heights.
Con:
1. Poor work life balance and long working hours.
2. Does not pay as well compared to other banks.
3. People in top positions are usually foreign talent. Hires a lot of foreigners compared to Singapore Citizens.

Title: Innovation without cleaning up legacy items
Pro: Stable company, good benefits
Con: Too many legacies issues. Sometimes new staff is just throw into the sea to work with no guidances or guidance from people who doesn't know the whole picture - this results in operational risk - which ironically is what the bank is trying to minimize. Most dept will just paint the good pic. Bank encourage innovations but sometimes there's so many ideas from depts which are implemented that even employees are confused. Employees are already tired as it is and they have to cope with new learning. If you truly wan innovation - clean up the legacy items first.

Title: Overworked
Pro: I'm still finding any after working here for 1yr
Con: DAH 2 employees are slaves for DAH employees. They will give you unreasonable deadlines and will make you work over weekends in exchange for compensation off days which you will never be able to take because of the same work which made you stay in office last weekend. All the managers are helpless puppets in front of DAH Singapore people.

Title: CSO - Senior Officer
Pro: DBS has the best perks for any employees. Generous with their "freebies" such as random catering of the in trend snacks (YOLE, Ice cream etc), always stocking up the pantry with food, random food buffet,   always mindful of other religion's diet etc
Con: Aggressive push for outcomes/ good stats. Quantity over quality. Best CSO are awarded based on highest number of calls instead of best quality CSATs. Some CSOs has high call numbers because they constantly transfer calls that they were supposed to handle to other departments. While others have lower call numbers because they answer these transferred calls.

Title: Graduate Associate
Pro: - As a graduate associate at the bank, you will be assigned to more critical task in the department. Manager will all have high expectation on you. (Of course, this may be slightly different depends on department. Therefore, during interview, you may want
Con:
- Since you are the only batch of program hire within Technology and Operation, you are always assigned to a lot of ad hoc task outside your duty. 
- There is a service bond to commit if you didn't finish your programme.

Title: Good benifits but Bad work culture
Pro:
Cab facility(regular times, extra hours at scheduled times)
Can claim for food bills and cab bills if you are working extra time. Mostly no limit on the bills.
Overall good salaries and bonus(based on the project budget)
Training sessions and technical competitions.
Good looking workplace designs.
Helping HR teams and office staffs.
High end laptops to work.
Special focus on ladies security.
Lots of celebrations, food festivals, outing.
Gym bills reimbursement. 
Indoor games, TT, billiards,  carom board etc.
Con:
No time limits. Extend almost everyday atleast 4more hours.
They dont feel shy to please for work on every saturday and sunday.
Compoffs and leaves are just name sake.
Middle Management is timepass. They just make work done by subordinates and submit as they work.
People Managers are more then technical Managers.
Spends plenty of money for celebrations, when comes to salary hike, they say budget.
Only one resting room for over 1000 employees.
If two persons sick at same time. Other person to stay at his workplace or to leave home. 
No resting and freshup facility for the staff who had to work more then 24hrs countinously(mostly on saturdays and Sunday long running CRs)
Impractical decisions by Management side.
No process and no formalities untill work goes.
20% of employees works on more than one project. Officially one, unofficially many.
Somewhere people who simply impress managers can stay longer and get promotions rather than who takes responsibilities and complete work in time.

Title: Backend - No work life balance & depressing working culture
Pro: Good staff benefits, 26 days annual leave and stable company
Con:
Senior management uses condescending words and threaten to put negativitve comments in appraisal as their management style when they heard not good feedback and they do not listen to explanation 

Do not practice open communication, seniors will "complain" to managers when clarification and miscommunication can be avoided by just thrashing out in person. Bullying by seniors-complain to bosses instead of just face-to-face clarifications and usually managers will side seniors or "scared" of them to be objective. Shouts at new staff in public when seniors found a mistake made. 

No worklife balance

Very local culture, i.e. Boss and seniors (regardless of rank as long as they are there longer than you) are always right

Title: Good learning ground for fresh grads
Pro: Good training programme, especially beneficial for fresh grads. Good mentorship (depends on the branch you get in). DBS provides you most of the necessity for you to work (training, mentorship, sales materials, even an iPad). Good career progression.
Con: With all the necessity provided, the rest is on your own to survive the competitive sales arena. In sales, you don't earn more for working hard and longer hours. It is best fit for the sleepless wolf. A place of constant progression and contemplation, a place to push yourself and hone your ability to focus, to excel, and to achieve consistent sales targets for the company.

Title: Associate
Pro:
Good Facilities
Good Pay and Benefits.
Con:
Very long hours.
Toxic and political work culture.
Long meetings not talking about work.
Waste a lot of time doing presentation slides for internal meetings.

Title: dbs
Pro: DBS offered the best Leave package and they do offer incentives and bonuses. Allowance is given for those shifting jobs, you can claim for taxi fares.
Con: Very hard to get some documents at HR, PC are not cleaned in technical terms whereby needed to delete old files or defrag, causing it to be very slow. In the last 2 years, not an upgrade or pc clean was done to boost technical performance.

Title: Management Associate
Pro:
The MA program has really taken account of previous feedback making it a strong program for career growth.  

Overall, the people are truly a pleasure to work with, and there is a genuinely positive work culture, with committed mentorship from senior management. Resources are also generous to encourage a learning culture, whether it is providing constant training on soft/hard skills.  

Much of the work is project based throughout rotations, and MAs are encouraged to be innovative.  People who are proactive, and display PRIDE values will thrive and be recognised for sure.
Con: None that comes to mind

Title: Terrific Culture
Pro: new technologies,Decent pay,Transportation,parties,independent task,Edge Technologies
Con:
Everything is cons here if you want to work here peacefully,Everyone are in trance in this company that they are following IT etiquette's  but god must know.
They say Agile but you see many of the managers in the name of Agile mismanaging lot of things
no proper organizing work
No proper work flow
Your self esteem anyways had to get down
co -Employee treat you like a college going student,Many nick names, no professionalism,
People think they are very smart but god knows they are in deep Risk

Title: Technology Teams is a big mess among teams
Pro: Colleagues are friendly and professional. Great place to work if you don't have to deal with technology teams.
Con: Teams within Technology cannot even work together. There is no overall architect to provide solution governance. Developers are not experience and solutions are half baked.

Title: Senior Management are active and committed to the growth of the bank
Pro:
- Good work life balance
- Easy access to Senior management 
- Meritocratic
- Stable job
- Smart/Hardworking individuals will stand out naturally in the organization
- 2 + 2 years internal mobility program gives staff an opportunity to explore other
Con:
- Staff welfare & benefits can be improved
- Middle management may not be as committed
- Somewhat conservative work culture

Title: You need to mix with the right people
Pro: Big brand name on your CV. The org is so huge that you learn alot of peocesses and it made you a more resilient person at work.
Con: Political. You need to suck up to the right people to climb ul the rank. Communication is closed. If speak up too much and is comments which are not desirable, you will be marked.

Title: Bureaucratic top down management
Pro:
A good starting ground for wealth management industry
Good benefits
Con:
During KPI months from Jan to Sep, expect to work every single day of the week. Saturday banking and Sunday roadshows included. Roadshows are not compulsory but there is peer pressure to attend. 
Commission structure is very bad. Top performers in the region may not even be able to get 5 figure payout per quarter. 
Very insurance focused. A lot of product pushing.

Title: No work life balance.
Pro:
1. Good Salary.
2. Opportunity to work on latest technology.
3. Good employee Benefits.
Con:
1. No work life Balance. You will feel the real work pressure here :-) and this applies to most of projects in IBGT.
2. Office hours starts 8:30 AM. End time is not quite certain for development resources:-).
3. Weekend work is quite usual as well. 
4. Very frequent deployment and If you are supporting then frequent night outs.
5. Overall - Not good if you have family commitments.

Title: Working enviroment
Pro: Family-like working environment despite the difference in posts, the hierarchy rarely matters. The staffs have no qualms helping on another despite their workload as well.
Con: In the working environment, the job can be rather monotonous at times and there isn't much learning that could be done.

Title: Great company to work for!
Pro:
- Great environment
- Good career advancement, given the right team and opportunity
- Good and competitive salary, and great benefits!
- Technology wise, the most advanced amongst the local banks
- Great CEO and leadership, with a strong and clear vis
Con: Can't complain much. I really enjoy working there.

Title: Great Place to start career but not as great for middle career progression
Pro: very friendly people, a lot of learning opportunites avaliable for junior staff members, supervisors who are interested in your career development
Con: lack of career advancement opportunities, changes are relatively slow, the pay for more senior professionals are not competitive compared to market

Title: Super Cool Encouraging Boss, brings the best out.
Pro:
. Super cool and very encouraging boss, brings the best out.
. Ability to Experiment and be heard.
. Flexible Working Hours
. Work Life Balance
Con: Some departments are slow and have a bureaucratic approach and slow to respond. If you can be the change you will be an achiever here.

Title: Relationship Manager
Pro: Affable colleagues and culture. Good employee benefits

Title: Good culture, mediocre benefits
Pro: #NAME?

Title: Stable job with steady low increment
Pro:
Stable job
Relative friendly environment
Company's culture and policy constantly being improved
Middle banding can expect around 5% increment
Good for people who are well paid before they join the bank because they get both high salary and stability!
Con:
Relatively lower paid compared to foreign banks.
Lack of international exposure
Relatively slow career progression for people who first join the financial industry

Title: Good and Progressive
Pro: Good culture, increasingly dynamic and expanding. Given ample opportunities and team is supportive. So far there is also minimal concern about job security.
Con: Can be quite messy at times and can be quite political as well depending on the situation. Bank need to scale up if it wants to be a force to be reckoned with

Title: Analyst
Pro: Great employee benefits, lots of leaves entitlement and opportunities for internal mobility
Con: People who are looking for work life balance and family centric place, this wouldn't be an ideal place to be.

Title: Negative
Pro: Overall, it is a friendly place to work in where staff of ranks AVP and below works well together majority of the time.
Con:
Most of the SVPs and MDs are only interested in playing their political games and not interested in working. After all, they will still get their fantastic salary at the end of the month. 

Poor are the junior staff who needs to work very hard to be recognised, only if their VP are a responsible manager, which is a rare find in this bank.

Rewards are given to only who is good terms with senior management.

- Processes are not

Title: Great company to work with
Pro: They would react to the macro trend very quickly, taking the initiative to improve the corporate brand. They treated the staff nicely and offered a lot of training opportunities.
Con: The career prospect was good for some departments, but not all. And they seemed to prefer recruiting ready-to-work talents from outside rather than grooming home-made talents, which was frustrating. The lower rank people had little promotion and advancement opportunities. Worked overtime every single day - 8:30am to 8:30pm at least, but maybe it is the 'usual' working hours for banking industry.

Title: About company culture
Pro: Good company and Good culture
Con:
One of the most faltu hiring practice in the company. The hiring leads and a few of his colleagues are involved in big scam of hiring through agencies by taking big amount for processing their candidates. They already earned in lakhs of rupees and there is no control on the scam.

I joined technology team with lot of respect to the organisation.If this practice continues without stopping all reputation build by company will be destroyed. Iam not sure how company can have such people in the hiring team. Some candidates directly approached during drives for money. I hope management will take action the team.

Title: Bancassurance Specialist
Pro:
The benefits are good.
The number of annual leave is great!
There is the company's club that gives special deals for leisure.
You get good rates if you want to get a loan.
Con:
Absolutely no work life balance.
Colleagues are not exactly friendly.
Lots of regulations to abide and be cautious of.

Title: It pays to be a cog
Pro: I liked the role, primarily because it paid well. Other compensation benefits were also adequate and matched my expectations (even slightly exceeding it).
Con: It was too structured, perhaps to a fault. The hierarchy was intensive leaving no flexibility in terms of innovating. This really changed the experience from a positive one to a neutral one.

Title: DBS Bank
Pro: Passionate, Relationship Led, Integrity Focused, Dedicated to Teamwork, Excelling with Confidence - Good management level with clear strategic goals makes this bank one of the best in region.
Con: Especially for the technology departments, I wouldn't advice as there is a huge proportion of contracted employees through vendors. To become perm, they are working unnecessary more hours (giving away the work-life balance) and this creates an unfair competition for perm employees.

Title: T&S
Pro: Very chill, friendly and everyone is willing to teach you. I was able to learn a lot since my supervisor assigned me to different desks sometimes when I done with work early. Training is definitely very structured and outstanding in DBS and working environment is very good.
Con: Sometimes the work can get boring - but really depends on which department you are in and what type of work you are interested.

Title: work for 3yrs
Pro: good benefits,  good welfare, people are generally nice on the surface
Con: quite political, hierarchical, must suck it up to bosses to make it, progression depends on tenure in bank rather than whether your performance is good or not, at least for my department. work-life balance is quite tough, as the work load keeps piling up very quickly

Title: Awesome employees but worst managers in HYD
Pro:
-Scope to learn new technologies
-You can learn to work in hectic environment
-Good competitions for ideas and innovation with good prizes
-There are some good initiatives by EDs
-Good working hours 8.30am to 5.30pm if your manager is good
Con:
-Some managers (VP, SVP) are saddist and they have very negative political mindset
-Hike is not as good as compared to market during annual performance cycles 
-Some managers don't have technical skills and they don't understand the system and expect to d

Title: Having worked in multiple SME and also government jobs prior to DBS, this is the best the best you can get
Pro: Employee Benefits especially annual leave. Supportive colleagues from within the same team/department.
Con: Long hours especially for those working in BO. Projects that require cross department/unit efforts may face challenges especially when those departments/units are just supporting the project rather than leading them. Processes can be very confusing for new joiner

Title: Nice people, nice company, nice experience
Pro: very nice colleagues, would like to get everyone involved and treat everyone well. Can learn a lot from people. The bank is also trying to offer a lot of opportunities to its people. Very impressive corporate culture.
Con: Limited to Asian, not many internationals here. Cantonese is the basic communication language  among people.

Title: Political Company
Pro: Infrastructure is good as it is new setup, learning and training are good, cab facility is provided.Online Learning sites are good
Con:
No recognition for people who really work instead awards are given to those who show off. Earlier Manager shows favourtism and does not anything technical
Managers at hyd cannot make any decisions and are dependent on singapore people. The hyd center is vendor to singapore. cost cutting has started as bonus are very less.Wasting money on infrastruture and unnecessary events.
Initial Pay was good when joined but no good hike.Makes  people move from one team to other team without considering their interest and acceptance

Title: Best Company to work, learn, grow and excel
Pro:
1. Best work culture and practices, 
2. Honestly saying Job Satisfaction is close to 100%,
3. Strong Performance in the market, so No need to fear about jobloss.
Con: 1. Sometimes work is stressful.

Title: Decent place to start out
Pro: Friendly working environment. The hierarchy is quite flat and the superiors are approachable and do value your feedback and inputs.
Con: Compensation could be more competitive, given its strategy to expand across Asia, more could be done to retain and recruit talent.

Title: Not a bad place if you want a stable job
Pro: Good bonus, good trainings available, generally friendly culture
Con: Strategy not aligned among different departments, not very innovative, every departments need to be working together to achieve common goal - therefore KPI across departments have to be aligned, middle management needs to be trained more how to lead their teams.

Title: I worked in the consumer investment and insurance products group in the commercial bank as a summer analyst.
Pro:
Great mentorship there from everyone in the team
Alot of opportunities to interact with senior management
Wide variety of work to do, although not very challenging.
Con:
Easy and mundane work due to it being commercial banking.
They hire 95% from the local universities which makes it a very stagnant culture.
Lack of opportunities to get fulltime employment.

Title: Boss is bigger than anything
Pro: Pay well, stable job,  company making profit. If you can survive and know how to handle your boss, a good place for retirement.
Con: No enough resource and time to do right work. Instead of doing your professional job,  struggling on pressure from boss and boss boss. Not professional in most cases. more time spend on ppt than real work. Have to hide issue instead work on it. Compare with other banks, over secured IT reduce efficiency and confuses all newbies.  The security team obviously don't know how to play with MAS.

Title: DAH2  Hyderabad a Great Place to Learn
Pro:
High technology focus, get to learn and work on new age tech stacks
Good senior leadership
Great learning & development practices
Con: India  Singapore relationship is not good.  India managers dont have too much control on how work is allocated.

Title: An integrated Asian experience with growth opportunities in Abundance
Pro:
-Stable, Well Capitalized
-Focussed Strategy
-Expanding, provides ample growth oppurtunities
-Work life balance
-Regional dominance
-Diverse Businesses
-Diverse Work force
Con:
-Interdepartmental cohesion not at its best
-Outdated processes, systems (focussed on short term solutions)
-Overall compensation (as compared to European counterparts)

Title: Global Transaction Service
Pro: The employees here are all talent in GTS, besides, the interior design is very comfortable. It's a good place to stay.
Con: The choices of the restaurant is not enough near DBS, because it's in Xinyi district, all of the foods there are very expensive.

Title: DBS is considered one of the safest banks globally and has a strong presence in Asia.
Pro: Good work life balance with competitive benefits. Strong management who consider inputs from all employees. Has been consistently improving in terms of profitability.
Con: Base salaries are not as competitive as other foreign banks hence it is not able to attract as many talents. However, overall package is still competitive.

Title: A performance driven work environment with strong emphasis on digifying processes, with pretty good staff benefits
Pro: Clear KPIs set out, has strong customer base, and staff empowerment. Remuneration is competitive as compared to industry and staff benefits are good
Con: Fully sales based and slightly longer hours in business unit. No time to partake in part time further studies. Efforts to capture/retain market share is very strong.

Title: Worst company to Work
Pro: Cab facility, good package for new joinees, best company for lead or above role, because 95% people of these roles do not work. Good for people who are good event organizers and maintain rapo with management
Con: Worst company, most of the lead or above roles do not add any value to the company and these people are very good at playing politics. Lot of favoritism while giving promotions, providing opportunities, appraisal. People wgo are really working hard for the company are treated as slaves and not considered for appraisal. People who maintaibs good rapo with management or hr, they get good ratings, promotions and organization level awards. While announcing awards by hr people to specific management puppets, while hearing the reason employees use to laugh.

Title: Good exposure, great mentorship
Pro: Best bank in the world, what more is there to say?
Con: At times, you wish you could put in a little more hours, spend a little more time with your financial model, and build stronger bonds with your colleagues in the team.. the bank has an emphasis on work life balance and spending more time with family is actively encouraged.

Title: Many good colleagues, but also fair share of terrible ones
Pro: Cross-department/business line collaboration isn't as painful as in some other banks. Five on Five policy for Fridays is good, plus staff cafeteria with a bay view.
Con: They do tolerate some really verbally abusive managers for quite a while. And some senior guys who disappear for hours on end and don't show up for meetings.

Title: Good Co-Workers
Pro:
Co-Workers are great
Reporting manager was super helpful
Lots of learning opportunities
Con:
Long work hours
Terrible upper management
People go with hierarchy

Title: DBS Summer Analyst Review
Pro:
- Great mentorship from senior level members
- Friendly environment, especially for interns who need help learning 
- After/during work social bonding (i.e. getting drinks with co-workers, going for lunch/dinner)
Con:
- Hard to interact with other interns, there could be more social events to network with them
- There is no post-internship job offers that are given to my knowledge, which is discouraging

Title: Eye opening experience. Processes are much more convulated than you can imagine.
Pro: It has great culture and environment. The people here are very friendly and helpful. There is also good corporate identity.
Con: Compensation is pathetic and perhaps even humiliating. If not so for senior positions, it is so for junior positions. Fresh graduates get 30% less from DBS than from other banks.

Title: A fast paced bank but don't ever miss hitting your quarterly budget.
Pro: U learn a lot and colleagues and systems are dynamic
Con: Immediate boss bends backward and forward. Staff end up feeling disgruntled and many senior guys had left. The bank itself has also become too big and too bureaucratic. The environment has turned political and driven solely by numbers

Title: Strong vision and leadership team
Pro: The bank has a very clear vision and strategic priorities to achieve its digital transformation and sustainability agenda. CEO and leadership team cascade this message and continuously engage employees to ensure alignment and a strong sense of purpose. Incredibly fast paced but a great place for someone who wants to learn, work on exciting projects and stay ahead of the curve.
Con: The company is changing rapidly and this may be uncomfortable for some. For those new to the organisation, there's a need to adapt to contribute effectively.

Title: Digital Bank to the Core
Pro: DBS invest in some of the most cutting edge technologies, enabling its employee to work digitally. The iFlex benefit and iTime policy also enables us to take full control of our benefit and working schedule.
Con: As all transforming companies, people need to catch up with the technology being introduced and need to learn to work with technology - sadly not everyone is catching up fast enough!

Title: Good, but can be better
Pro: Friendly people, willing to teach and share, bank is doing well with good future prospects (as of 2013)
Con: Frequently have to travel between offices, which can be annoying and time-consuming, doesn't seem to have much work-life balance

Title: Surveys are filled by managers and leads. Micromanagement at it's peak. No anonymity
Pro: Not applicable. Nothing new. Working on 10 years old tech stack.
Con:
Most of people work in DBS are either tired or they just want to save their job. They don't ask questions to anyone.

Recently anonymous survey link was given to all employees and all manager & leads sat near to each employee and filled themselves. That's how DBS works.

When I talked to HR about this survey problem they told that talk to your manager. It's between you and your manager.

Don't ever join this organization.

Title: Senior Service Executive
Pro:
it's a learning path process, good benefits for staff. 
pay increment , and high bonus paid depends on performance.
Con: Office politics exist everyday, cross sell insurance product for service staff with target 6-8 per month. no life balance, as your off day will be canceled if it is lack of manpower, no overtime pay for rank BEB and above,

Title: DAH2 C2E:political hotbed managed by narcissism,  undemocratic, autocracy rule
Pro: You can learn politics easily here and how to adopt to yes boss culture
Con: The C2E department is worst managed by rule of rod. There is no democratic process.  Those who have to manage department culture are playing with junior career.  Just concluded piegonhole survey and answers are cryptic with no regard to high standard of DBS organization.  The department is run as private property of few HIPPO people who enjoy absolute power

Title: Not as prestigious as you might think
Pro:
1) You're working in the 'world's best bank'.
2) You can call yourself a banker.
3) Staff benefits are terrific.
Con:
Wow.. Where do I start?

If you're joining as a "Wealth Planning Manager", and believe that you're getting a prestigious job (particularly after those IQ tests they put you through online), you're drinking the kool-aid. Anyone with half the average IQ can get in. If you're holding a good university degree, please don't waste your time and seek better professions elsewhere.
In this role, there are only two things you can do day in and day out. Cold call people, and convince them to purchase insurance products. If you're not an insurance specialist, you get the added privilege of selling housing loans and unit trusts. Don't kid yourself with the idea that you're helping people - 99% of WPMs are doing it for the commission, so do ahead and employ dirty tricks to get that money. (Don't quote me on this.)
Management is a hit or miss depending on where you are deployed to. Managers are former top sales WPMs. That's the only criteria aside from having your boss favour you. You're blessed if you have any form of capable mentorship to help you excel at your role. Expect long work hours cold-calling people. Does not stimulate me.
That said, depending on your colleagues around you, work environment is fantastic. Expect some sexism, homophobia and racial ignorance, but that's pretty typical.

Backend operations is completely incompetent. Try to get in touch with any operation support team and face a dead end. Lack of seamless communication within their own internal structure makes processes more complicated than they should be.

If you are keen on joining, think hard and long about the career path you wish to attain. Ensure that you have a transferable skillset should you opt out of banking/insurance sales, or stay on and hope you make it to management. Even after all that I have said, the possible career progression is still decent.

Title: Other than this year' bonus and increment, I've been happy so far
Pro: Loan preferential rate, savings interest preferential rate, banking privilege, share option, S$1,000 maternity benefits upon delivering
Con: no guaranteed 13th month, little bonus, little increment, rigid internal system & process, messy technical approval system (for IT line)

Title: Life in DBS
Pro: Established local bank with growing reputation in Asia region. Strong Asian culture and value. Provide employees with courses to enrich themselves further. Good benefits such as high number of leaves and medical coverage.
Con: While certain jobs allow work-life balance, some jobs require OT till very late almost daily. Pay wise is acceptable as a local bank, but considerably low as compared with prestigious foreign banks.

Title: Okay at first, then slowly became frustrating.
Pro:
Decent Benefits
- Monthly remuneration on the low side
- Other benefits such as employee share option scheme make up for it. However you have to work longer than a year to enjoy such benefits.

Decent work life balance
Con:
Conservative mindset that impedes learning and career advancement
Biased employee engagement survey results

Title: Deceiving company
Pro: Pretty good benefits. Nice pantry, and the physical environment is pretty modern and technologically updated. Building looks nice. Security is quite top-notch. Bank takes care to protect customers' details.
Con: Unable to utilise benefits/leave (subject to approval), demanding supervisors, colleagues are those who will stab you behind your back. Keeps changing policies. HR spews propaganda but in reality, working environment is not that great.

Title: Need to be politically savvy, not much recognition for talent. Politics takes priority over talent
Pro:
Good Salary and benefits. 
Good brand to work for.
Con:
Lacks in technology Strategy. Though employee benefits are good, employee welfare is not a priority. Very superficial.

Training not in line with role performed.

Title: Customer Service Officer at Call Center Department, 6 months plus. 0/10 Do not recommend.
Pro:
Benefits are good, 24 days AL 2 day family care leave, 30 days medical leave. 
Colleagues are very nice people, they will go extra to help out.
Con:
1. Applying for leave at the call center department is very difficult and there is an unwritten rule that it is frowned upon. Managers will write people up for even taking sick leave which is unethical and ridiculous. 

2. Most team managers  only cares about meeting their own metrices, they don't care about the well being of their reports. If you are lucky you will get assigned to a good TM, otherwise your time there will be frustrating. 

3. If you do overtime it will be compensated as off in lieu. The catch is that it is so hard to get off, you might as well give them free OT. There are people trying to utilize their off in lieu for months but their requests are rejected with dumb reasons such as not able to take post shift off for pm shifts. 

4. Same problem for the rest of your leave. Birthday time off etc. since it is next to impossible to get them. 

5. Systems are unreliable and will fail at least 2 times every month but you are expected to get on without them. The back up system is useless and you cant access  the important files in the intranet you need for references. Any mistakes that you make even when systems are down is on you and will become part of your performance report. 

6. You will deal with difficult people every day. It is what the company is paying you for. Not recommended for the faint-hearted. Get ready to spend thousands on therapy.

Title: Too much politics and marketing at Senior Level
Pro: Trainings on new technology,transport is free and good,waverock building is new
Con: Bad leaders and much of work politics, regional play,outside hyderabad people are working hard and rewards going to local people. I joined consumer banking to learn payments but learning just how to code UI and impress SG people with POC. Everything said by SG is followed by local people. Feedback is by SG managers and local managers just nod. Blindly follows SG people. Survey is filled but when I fill own I get blacklist by manager. It is better to give top score.

Title: Decent benefits and salary for an entry level position
Pro: I came in through one of their graduate programs. The salary and benefits are competitive to that of the market.
Con: Though I'm in a grad program, there is little to none centralised training, which was different from the impression I got before I came in.

Title: Blend of East and West Cultures
Pro: Loads of clientele. Micromanagement kept to a moderate level. Entire bank has a singular purpose and clarity in its goals and objectives.
Con: Compensation is on the lower end in the industry. Technology is outdated but slowly improving.

Title: Great working environment and culture, but progression is slow
Pro:
• friendly and helpful colleagues
• good working environment 
• flexible work hours
• shuttle buses provided
• good employee welfare and benefits
Con:
• work progression is very slow
• have to work at least 3-4 years before promotion
• high volume of work
• hires the wrong people for the job

Title: Branch Business Manager
Pro: If you get a good BBM your days at work is heavenly, even tho it’s a sales role.
Con: If you get a bad BBM, then best is if you resign and find something better

Title: In the midst of having my internship there. Would say I like the culture of the good. My department has lots of activities for bonding. My colleagues are nice too.
Pro: Can knock off early on Friday, 5pm. But this varies among departments and among of workload you have.
Con: Haven't experience anything bad. So far so good.

Title: Deserves only 2 stars 1 for facilities 1 for pay
Pro: Good facilities, cab, encashment for medical expenses
Con: No work life balance, lot of pressure, onsite counterparts say to complete the task by eod however complex it might, no proper management non cooperative managers and leads no team bonding activities, no fun at work, no encourage for sports no proper ETA hurry in deliveries fail in prod lot of rework nature , nothing to learn new worst technically lmplemented projects

Title: INSURANCE SPECIALIST
Pro:
Extremely good system, well remunerated. 
Easy to do business with strong business support
Encouraging managers, good working environment
Upward progression is fast and possible. Eg. Insurance Specialist to RM and RM to Manager.
Con:
extremely long hours

internal career change to other departments (eg Sales to Marketing)might be tougher due to the large number of candidates who already have prior experience on the role.

Title: Good place to start off you banking career
Pro:
*Solid training programs to build your foundation
*Great people, willing to help one another mostly.
*Fortunate to meet a good boss that taught me alot
Con:
*Can be rather strict and rather "by the book" at times
*Pay and comms are not that fantastic when compared to other banks but at least its constant.

Title: Good time, good experiences
Pro:
- Nice office, good environment, not much difference between intern and permanent staffs
- Decent pay, slightly above market average for intern
- I was involved in many aspects and had quite alot of experiences although the workload is quite high
Con: #NAME?

Title: Great place to work
Pro:
- Good bonding between colleagues
-  Not too bad bonus
- Predictable working hours
- 21 days annual leaves
- Good employee benefit
Con:
- Diversity is not great
- Brand name is not very strong
- People work in an unstructured way, which could be improved

Title: Overall good.
Pro: Fantastic ambience, work culture and decent pay. CoOperative superiors. Employee friendly. Good process for continually educating employees.
Con: Too many changes in the management. No set processes, not very flexible in terms of customer service. No new products or good products.

Title: Bank Executive
Pro:
Best bonus structure.
Salary very competitive. 
Company focuses on employee empowerment and engagement. 
Company very innovative.
Con: The very traditional work ethics of colleagues who have been with the bank for over 20 years.

Title: On the right track but need to be a lot clearer
Pro: Great benefits, treats staff very well, there is a semblance of work life balance, great colleagues all around
Con: Senior management has no idea what to do with the direction. Sets a KPI for a while then changes another direction completely

Title: Nice working place
Pro: An open environment with kind colleagues and pleasant atmosphere. It is exciting to see and learn from hardworking seniors. The connection between global branches is solid and the problem-solving efficiency is accordingly high.
Con: Personal growth is limited as a contractor. Trivial things are not in a small amount and quite annoying sometimes, but those process are somehow necessary.

Title: Innovation without cleaning up legacy items
Pro: Stable company, good benefits
Con: Too many legacies issues. Sometimes new staff is just throw into the sea to work with no guidances or guidance from people who doesn't know the whole picture - this results in operational risk - which ironically is what the bank is trying to minimize. Most dept will just paint the good pic. Bank encourage innovations but sometimes there's so many ideas from depts which are implemented that even employees are confused. Employees are already tired as it is and they have to cope with new learning. If you truly wan innovation - clean up the legacy items first.

Title: Great learning experiences, openness and action oriented
Pro: Leadership, learning  from colleagues, learning opportunities, working on latest technologies openness to feedback, clear attempts to action on feedback
Con: work planning, recognising individuals for good work

Title: DBS leads the way in the global financial race
Pro: Good compensation, motivated coworkers, ASEAN leader racing towards global influence, mobility, results.
Con: Competitive spirit could been seen as intimidating to those not motivated towards success.

Title: A bank with a fintech dream
Pro:
Systematic training
Technology vision and focus
Innovation endeavors
Keeping up with the digital trend
Con:
Very messy resources planning 
Country senior management controls like monarchy- his henchmen manipulated all evaluation and decisions while treating other staff like his slavea
HR sucks- HR does anything but helpful

Title: DBS Bank as a full time sales staff
Pro:
- if you get a good boss, you have work life balance
- good internal mobility processes but I feel it constraints you to similar or related roles only
Con:
- HR sides the bosses, not you
- Hiring too may ex-UOB bosses and bringing over the bad culture
- too much red tape

Title: Sales
Pro: Competitive salary package in the organization, great working environment and friendly team. Good welfare and working hours for employees
Con: Nothing negative about it. It's a local bank with international ambitions. It expanded very quickly

Title: Good
Pro:
Good culture, though dependent on the team and unit you are in.
Can be well paid, and there is a culture of moving people around to grow them.
Stable business and employer.
Con: Some teams can have an international mindset but there is still not enough cultural diversity outside of the top ranks. Bureacractic, though perhaps that is true of all large banks.

Title: Challenging in both good and bad ways
Pro: You will be stretched to do new things. It's very performance and outcome driven so there is pressure, but increasingly encouraging a fail better learning environment and culture.
Con: Traditional hierarchy style of management. Politics abound and you may not be able to get things done as directly as they should be. Some managers are still abusive in the way they talk.

Title: Bancassurance Specialist
Pro: Many benefits (e.g. medical, holiday claims, etc...), excellent colleagues and superiors.  Lots of events (corporate or personal) to mingle with your colleagues and superiors.
Con: Can get a little stressful when you do not hit your target.  Definitely not a 9 to 5 job.  More like 8 to 8.

Title: Flexible org but very less growth opportunities
Pro:
Office is colourful, vibrant
Flexible teams
Approachable management
Con:
Managers are partial and if you good repo with them, you will get good projects and better opportunities
No on-site , not even short term

Title: Not great
Pro: Convenient shifts for a student and lots of opportunities to learn about products
Con: The manager in general. My interview questions were answered for me because the manager decided I "look the part".  Honestly have no idea how someone so incompetent has managed to maintain a role as a manager for so long whilst making so many inappropriate remarks.

Title: Mixed feeling.
Pro: The pay is good, the leave is good, the medical benefits are excellent. Monetary wise, a perfect company. Good reputation. Great for stepping stone.
Con:
Contact Centre has high attrition rate than normal in 2013 due to a change in management.
Appraisal was hardly fair. Doubt any attempt to try to be fair in the department. Performance framework is well developed but it is often abused.

Title: Working enviroment
Pro: Family-like working environment despite the difference in posts, the hierarchy rarely matters. The staffs have no qualms helping on another despite their workload as well.
Con: In the working environment, the job can be rather monotonous at times and there isn't much learning that could be done.

Title: Very regimental and systematical.
Pro: Good staff benefits and frequent engagement of staff in events. Work a lot with foreigners in a fast paced environment.
Con: Very regimental where numbers are very important and in most cases illogical. People do not question the management despite the illogical decisions sometimes. Feels like I am working with robots and machine

Title: IT Professional Suicide.. Everything is FAKE
Pro:
- Good Salary
- Stable
- Good WorkMates
- If you are used to do nothing, this is your place
- If you love copy paste from a web, to a excel, to an email.. this is your place.
Con:
Everything about DBS Technology, is false. Pure propaganda, nothing is real.
The job descriptions are absolutely misleading to hunt talent and waste it, you may be applying for a specific position but you will be doing something totally different and irrelevant.
DBS is stuck in the 90's IBM ways and achieve technology goals is barely impossible, perform basic tasks can take you months of bureaucracy.
Terrible monitoring and alerting fully surrounded of old fashion technologies 99.9% just Java.. not much room for improvement (No Docker, No Python, No Go, No real Cloud, No IaaC, No Labs) as LOBs are totally decoupled from TS who controls everything and do nothing.

The offices are the worst environment i've worked so far in my 15+ years of career, to a point that I had daily skin rashes.. you can walk around and see desks or rugs not cleaned in one year... a real shame for a bank that waste so much money in unnecessary proprietary software but cut costs in keeping clean the work environments... DBS is under a transformation, which Is mainly about rename teams to trend labels, the tasks stills old-fashion and obsolete. They talk too much about Agile and DataDriven.. but the only thing of Agile that this organization do is avoid documentation at all.

 I could not fit in this organization and decided to left because the position was like everything else in this place, fake.

Title: Long time employees are DBS worst enemy
Pro: Stable well paid job, subordinates never challenges whats being said and done
Con:
Politics is everything, performance or technical knowledge has no value at all in managements eyes. 
Long timers hide information from newbies or even make fun of them just to slow down their work. 
Middle managers are not experienced enough to know what is important so they are easily fooled by people with the loudest voice.
 Talanted people usually leave the company rather quick.

Title: You need to explore your 25th hour in a day to balance work-life
Pro: Need to dig a lot to find Pro's
Con:
No Employee friendly Culture
No Personal Life- Work Life Balance, You MUST be available 24 X 7 / 366 days (even in non-leap year)
Leadership definition of Agile is  (Micro management, Dead lines, asking status of work every 15 mins, Pick 200% work & deliver all) 
No open feedback culture
PTO (Page Turn Over) - Refer to Next section please, if you need more.

Title: Architect
Pro: Challenging environment.  A good place to exercise a lot of creativity.
Con: A lot of process.  Could spend a lot of time trying to figure out how to work the process than real work.

Title: Great Organization!!
Pro: Great CEO, people are nice and yet focused on business objectives. Supportive of staff development. Exciting times to be in the bank now as it embark on its transformation
Con: generally you will need to be able to keep up with the pace of change.and also to be able to multi task.

Title: Assistant VIce President - Fixed Income
Pro:
1. Flexibility to move to different departments within the bank
2. The management gives sufficient incubation time for new businesses
Con:
1. Pay / rank parity is not great even at the time of lateral hiring.
2. Salary hikes seem to be linked to Singapore inflation even in high inflation countries.

Title: Good experience, nothing much to expect due to local culture
Pro: Share Ownership Scheme plan is great if you are looking to just stay there. Benefits in general are good too. Family friendly
Con: Hierarchy based, promotion very rigid and qualification based. Management has a slight bias when choosing promotees and doesn’t promote competition

Title: Associate
Pro:
Good Facilities
Good Pay and Benefits.
Con:
Very long hours.
Toxic and political work culture.
Long meetings not talking about work.
Waste a lot of time doing presentation slides for internal meetings.

Title: Great Place to Work in India
Pro:
1. Work Life balance of employees is Great
2. Sr Management / Managers are easily reachable even for the team member is lowest hierarchy.
3. DBS Cares - The bank has best HR policy. It recurits, retains and rewards the team members well.
Con: There are no cons here

Title: A good design team and culture
Pro:
The design team culture and work is good. The key managers are good and invested in your growth. The team is open to innovating the way they work. You are expected to take ownership and drive key results and outcomes

Overall its a goo
Con: The process (though changing)  is a little slow.

Title: Good work-life balance
Pro: Good work-life balance and plenty of perks (family day, employee benefits)
Con: Mid level management is not progressive and is not willing to risk for the fear of repercussion. Some projects are done for the sake of showing senior management that work is done with no actual improvement or benefits.

Title: Poor mid-management, great culture
Pro:
Family-style of employment without job loss concerns
Desire to innovate and progress
Con:
Old guard are generally incompetent, shout and bully
Old guard not moved on and not a meritocracy

Title: Innovative, yet very political winner
Pro: Very innovative, vast opportunities to participate in strategic change the bank initiatives, CEO is on a roll to deliver record breaking results quarter upon quarter
Con: Extremely siloed and political environment. Although salaries are on par with the industry, benefits aren't.

Title: Bank with strong digital ambition
Pro: DBS takes care of their employees like any other bank. The bank has a strong outlook in terms of growth.
Con:
Might be too one dimensional with sales focus, but end of the day, in sales it's a numbers game. 
Very local work environment, will need some adjust for non-locals to work there.

Title: dbs
Pro: DBS offered the best Leave package and they do offer incentives and bonuses. Allowance is given for those shifting jobs, you can claim for taxi fares.
Con: Very hard to get some documents at HR, PC are not cleaned in technical terms whereby needed to delete old files or defrag, causing it to be very slow. In the last 2 years, not an upgrade or pc clean was done to boost technical performance.

Title: Deloitte First job
Pro: Fun people and lots of activities for team bonding. Superiors are well trained and will be willing to give you feedback
Con: Lots of work to do and the leaving rate is extremely high. Peers can be competitive sometimes

Title: Good place to work and grow . But no work life balance
Pro: Fast growing . Hence many opportunities . Very good place to learn and grow in your career if that’s your primary objective
Con:
V Demanding work culture. So no work life balance . 
Salary and compensation not so good but average as pet the market

Title: Transparency in Policy
Pro: DBS Bank Ltd a Very good company to work across banking.
Con: Too much micro-management and there is always a difference in what had been told and what is followed, is respective to India operations.

Title: High Paced Environment
Pro: Premier Bank in Asia, with a fairly organized training program for summer interns. Patient and friendly supervisors that work with even the most inexperienced interns.
Con: As a foreigner, I felt somewhat alienated from the close knit, almost strictly Singaporean co-workers. Didn't develop as tight of relationships as I would have liked.

Title: Working in DBS
Pro: Progressive, ability to execute to strategy which shows in the financial results, strong CEO, many fun activities.
Con: Hours can be long depending on which department you work in, IT systems, although improving, can be better.

Title: VP IBG
Pro: PRIDE - Purpose-driven, Relationship-led, Innovative, Decisive, and Everything Fun.  By demonstrating these core values, DBS hope to lead by example. And in sharing DBS knowledge and experience, shape the next generation of leaders in the banking services industry.
Con: SILO - reporting creates silo between departments

Title: Associate
Pro: Many opportunities and allow internal transfer under 2+2 programme
Con: A lot of challenges if your work requires you to deal with IT enhancements (which is getting more and more common here), such as endless meetings (as the stakeholders are in Changi office or India), long working hours, require to do system testing etc.

Title: Customer Service Officer
Pro: Environment to work at was filled with friendly and helpful people.
Con: Although most people are helpful, there are some team managers who are unhelpful, and would just say that they are busy. Or they cannot be found at their desk when they are the only TM on duty on that shift.

Title: Best infra and best policies
Pro:
Infrastructure, Policies, expertise of Management 
Flat hierarchy 
Easy to approach- anyone HR or Management
Appreciation for good work
Helpful Staff - Non technical
Con: Little work life balance issues due to totally new setup but that is ok as the company is growing. It will get better

Title: Worked at Toh Guan office
Pro: #NAME?
Con:
- Lots of "veterans" as colleagues
- not convenient location
- if miss shuttle bus service, need to walk at least 15 mins from MRT but if you like walking, good for you

Title: FTBA
Pro:
Above average salary for entry level sales. 
Competitive employee benefits.
Famous brand in Asia region.
Con:
Redundant company policies and operating procedures.
No work-life balance.
The brand is famous in Asia region, but not in Taiwan.
Most superior executives only concern about the sales performance and always look for opportunity to transfer to other bank. 
The company policies tend to shirk off the responsibilities to low level employees (by asking the employees to sign a lot of agreements.)
Slow in catching up the trend and Fintech, literally no innovation.

Title: Confusing
Pro: Good brand names. Many perks
Con: Many transition going on where policies owners are changed. Sometimes new policy owners or their staff does not have much ideas about the new portfolio they are having which makes it difficult to get things done. Too many changes and very disruptive.

Title: Room for improvement
Pro: Stable local bank that needs no introduction. I was lucky to be promoted quite fast during my term with the bank. Had good bosses I guess.
Con: Extremely high volume because of the number of clients in DBS hence resulting in long hours. HR has a habit of putting a quota on the number of people to be promoted so it's not entirely based on your merits.

Title: Ever growing in strength and leading the pack.
Pro: Solid culture and management that is enabling the whole organisation and participants to be led in clear manner. We have confidence and clarity from top management of where the bank is heading.
Con: Too many systems, downtimes, productivity concerns such that customer experienced are still found wanting by many users and also by staff. Understaffed in some branches.

Title: Nice Place with Learning Opportunities and Smart People
Pro: If you are lucky, you can be working with a really smart team, and people with very good work ethics whom you definitely look up to and learn from them.  Ample opportunities to learn at work as well as through external training.
Con: Hours can be long sometimes. Internal process can be inefficient at times which cause a lot of menial tasks and time being wasted

Title: It pays to be a cog
Pro: I liked the role, primarily because it paid well. Other compensation benefits were also adequate and matched my expectations (even slightly exceeding it).
Con: It was too structured, perhaps to a fault. The hierarchy was intensive leaving no flexibility in terms of innovating. This really changed the experience from a positive one to a neutral one.

Title: DBS Bank
Pro: Passionate, Relationship Led, Integrity Focused, Dedicated to Teamwork, Excelling with Confidence - Good management level with clear strategic goals makes this bank one of the best in region.
Con: Especially for the technology departments, I wouldn't advice as there is a huge proportion of contracted employees through vendors. To become perm, they are working unnecessary more hours (giving away the work-life balance) and this creates an unfair competition for perm employees.

Title: Work Experience at Treasury Market Operations
Pro: Friendly and cheerful environment. Staff benefits are above average in terms of claims, leaves, sick benefits and others.
Con: Not a department for people looking into finance jobs. Long working hours and unpaid overtime hours.

Title: Bureaucratic top down management
Pro:
A good starting ground for wealth management industry
Good benefits
Con:
During KPI months from Jan to Sep, expect to work every single day of the week. Saturday banking and Sunday roadshows included. Roadshows are not compulsory but there is peer pressure to attend. 
Commission structure is very bad. Top performers in the region may not even be able to get 5 figure payout per quarter. 
Very insurance focused. A lot of product pushing.

Title: Great management
Pro: Excellent staff benefits as a Bank. Bank allows staffs to learn things out of work context.
Con: Some deparments are too narrow minded, some are not. Makes staffs at the losing end dread working.

Title: Relationship Manager
Pro: Good compensation and many incentives, such as quarterly bonus and monthly vouchers. Good employee benefits such as annual leave and flexi benefits
Con: So far so good...I think the job rewards well as a fresh graduate . If you work hard it will pay off well.

Title: Good company to work with
Pro:
Pay scale will be good if you join with high Pay scale from your previous company.
Work atmosphere
Con: Few will have lot of work and few will be enjoying life. Work life balance may affect based on project we work.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Pro: Very knowledgeable and compassionate boss. Colleagues are willing to help and are all very knowledgeable in the area of data science. Fairly frequent employment welfare such as team breakfast.
Con: There is no formal job training for new interns, you have to learn their working platforms while doing your job.

Title: Forwarding looking and dynamic company
Pro: DBS has a great management team with forward looking visions and missions to take the company and people to the next level of excellence. One will constantly feel charged and challenged to progress with the company.
Con: To pace out new initiatives to be rolled out each year

Title: No work life balance.
Pro:
1. Good Salary.
2. Opportunity to work on latest technology.
3. Good employee Benefits.
Con:
1. No work life Balance. You will feel the real work pressure here :-) and this applies to most of projects in IBGT.
2. Office hours starts 8:30 AM. End time is not quite certain for development resources:-).
3. Weekend work is quite usual as well. 
4. Very frequent deployment and If you are supporting then frequent night outs.
5. Overall - Not good if you have family commitments.

Title: great place to work
Pro: great and wonderful colleagues to work with. well paying job with excellent yearly bonus. great brand name and prestige
Con: work can sometimes get a little bit too mundane and boring. not for someone who is not looking at staying in the banking and finance industry for long

Title: Had a worst experience
Pro:
You can learn new tech stack depends on the team and project.
You have access to good online resources for learning.
You have independency to make experiments again depends on the team.
Lot of parties and fun.
Wellness support with money.
Workpalce is good.
Con:
Your might feel stagnent growth in terms of Learning and finance.
Lot's of false promises by senior level.
Need more techinically strong managers and Architects, which is missing as of now.
HR department is living in worst case, contract HR have made the scene even more worst.

Title: Good digital bank for work from home
Pro: Bank provide all type of tools to allow me work from home which is very flexible
Con: Need manage new meeting culture for work from home

Title: Best Company to work, learn, grow and excel
Pro:
1. Best work culture and practices, 
2. Honestly saying Job Satisfaction is close to 100%,
3. Strong Performance in the market, so No need to fear about jobloss.
Con: 1. Sometimes work is stressful.

Title: Poor people development
Pro:
People generally friendly
Easy to get in
Big organisation, so get exposed to many different things
Big brand name in Singapore
Con:
Poor people development
Even though senior management has good views/ideas, doesn't get down to middle management and below
Quite political and management seems to reward those who play politics

Title: Decent place to start out
Pro: Friendly working environment. The hierarchy is quite flat and the superiors are approachable and do value your feedback and inputs.
Con: Compensation could be more competitive, given its strategy to expand across Asia, more could be done to retain and recruit talent.

Title: TOO boring
Pro: The part time pay is not bad. All u have to do is attend to the customers and ask if they need any help . There is overtime pay if exceed the minimum work hours.
Con: May have to work during the weekend. Job is boring and repetitive, have to attend to dissatisfied customers and hear their nagging and complains

Title: Not a bad place if you want a stable job
Pro: Good bonus, good trainings available, generally friendly culture
Con: Strategy not aligned among different departments, not very innovative, every departments need to be working together to achieve common goal - therefore KPI across departments have to be aligned, middle management needs to be trained more how to lead their teams.

Title: I worked in the consumer investment and insurance products group in the commercial bank as a summer analyst.
Pro:
Great mentorship there from everyone in the team
Alot of opportunities to interact with senior management
Wide variety of work to do, although not very challenging.
Con:
Easy and mundane work due to it being commercial banking.
They hire 95% from the local universities which makes it a very stagnant culture.
Lack of opportunities to get fulltime employment.

Title: Software Development Engineer
Pro: Pros are for those who wants to work for their retirement. If you like earning money without working any technical, then it is the biggest pro for you.
Con:
No proper management
Managers listens to their manager and when it comes to praise they will say I did and when they fail they will say team did it.
Old technologies and they even don't want to change(i.e. for them hadoop is latest technology)
And so on ... which you can find in other 1 star reviews.

Title: CUSTOMER SERVICE OFFICER  CONTACT CENTRE
Pro: 24 days AL + 2 days family leave
Con:
Don't even have a designated seat at work.
You can forget about having any holidays once join as you will be ask to come back with oil reimbursement which you can never get to claim back due to their service level being consistently bad.

Title: DAH2  Hyderabad a Great Place to Learn
Pro:
High technology focus, get to learn and work on new age tech stacks
Good senior leadership
Great learning & development practices
Con: India  Singapore relationship is not good.  India managers dont have too much control on how work is allocated.

Title: Bah
Pro: the brand name of the company
Con:
my boss was a slave driver who did not promote work life balance. 
and my supervisor did not care if i could cope with my work load. 
there was very little engagement.

Title: AVP
Pro:
Asian Bank present in  all leading asian economies
Good Ethics, focused in the Values of the company
Value Employees well and focused on their growth
Con:
Limited and sparsely present in India.
All strategic decisions are downloaded from Singapore
Need a bit more fine tuning for Indian market

Title: DAH2 is worst place to work for Girls
Pro: Infrastructure is good nothing else
Con: Worst company to work for, if you are joining do not join ops tech team. They do not respect women employees.  psycho leader drinks and come to office and shout on women employees. He makes them to sit overnights. Lot of regional feeling and promotions are given to only women who are very close to them all manners. Even his boss is puppet and wont even respond to women problems. Biggest tragedy is that HR even supports manager and ask us to think in managers perspective

Title: Bad Company to work with Specially CBGT
Pro: Nothing Pros here only if you are  butterer  and wants to sit idle in front of laptop whole day.
Con:
I do not know why they have opened Hyderabad center. The company Management is full of service company guys   who has done nothing is their life and expect the same as well. 
They will hire you by saying to work in product domain but you end up working under some non-permanent staff on some 15 years old  technology who is from some service based company like IBM  etc.

Title: Great working environment
Pro: Good working environment and good growth
Con: Not easy to change departments in the company

Title: Good work life balance
Pro: This is a bank with good work life balance. Team work is widespread not on within teams but also inter teams.
Con: Paper  work is heavy  and processes can be slow. Promotion is also varied, great dependence on bottom line revenue and profits.

Title: Intern
Pro: plenty opportunities,friendly staff but depends on which departments.
Con: sometimes the boss  may not see your contributions and efforts and like to made comparison with other fellow interns, but again depending on which department you are in. But overall, it's a good bank to work with !

Title: SME RM
Pro: Choosing own customers. Ownership. Good bosses. Learning opportunities. Leadership opportunities. Autonomy. Bosses are willing to teach and are willing to impart knowledge.
Con: Long hours depending on sales volumes. Systems are not linked which makes searching of information a hassle. Limited opportunity for overseas exposure.

Title: Good Org to work in
Pro: Good innovative culture. Forward looking. Worklife balance. Lovely colleagues.
Con: Managers might not be of the right calibre - might be a strong contributor but not of the right leadership. Applicable to some but not all.

Title: Branch Customer Service
Pro:
Able to meet people from all walks of life.
Suitable for people who are customer-oriented and enjoy meeting and talking to people.
Con:
Branch manager micro manage - toilet break duration, mobile phone to be kept in locker, permission to go for toilet. No flexibility in work schedule, branch manager will remove your leave/off if lack of manpower. 
Have to hit non-service related kpi - insurances sales, number of loan referral.

Title: Great staff benefits
Pro: 21 days annual leave, plus 2 days family leave. Compassionate leave applies to geandparents and in-laws too.
Con: Extremely fast-paced environment. Must learn to manage workload to avoid burnout or no personal life.

Title: Great forward looking culture and adequate work life balance
Pro:
The company values employee development. E-learning portal offers many useful courses for personal development.
There are flexible working arrangements
Company is forward looking and is committed to digital transformation.
Con: Low performers stay around longer than they should

Title: 3 years working at DBS Indonesia
Pro: Great & fresh overall culture, less-formal dress code for a bank, many other benefits besides salary, the bank is heading in the digital direction early.
Con: some products' SOP and policies are more rigid/strict, could adapt better to the fast-changing and demanding market.

Title: An org who provides enormous opportunity for everyone at any level
Pro: Good, innovative work space, new opportunities, best talents, experimental work
Con: Values, expectations and reality, need to improve further on leadership factor

Title: Poor culture and work life balance
Pro:
Opportunity to work on latest tech stack
Opportunity to learn and take ownership
Con:
Poor management and culture
Poor work-life balance
Expectations to work for long hours everyday and on weekends too
Excessive work pressure to deliver on time by incorporating frequently changing requirements by stretching
No time to work on self development or firm driven activities

Title: quite OK, not so stressful
Pro: in fact pay is quite well. Not so stressful. and a bit "family" like. And got more exposure as sitting in HQ
Con: anyway it's still a local bank and not so "fancy" comparing to the big names, business is not so deep.

Title: DBS is an aggressive company that enthusiastically strikes for Asian market, and will become a powerful in the future.
Pro: High salary, continued training & activity, stable capital of bank, friendliness of colleagues
Con: Too many rules, slow core system, too many works done by hand

Title: Growing Bank with plenty of opportunities
Pro: Bank is growing on a steady pace. It is a place with plenty of career opportunities for growth and development. Amazing CEO.
Con: Some pioneers of the bank are resistant to change. Still struck in the old school ways of doing things.

Title: Great local bank to work in
Pro:
- Compensation and benefits are reasonable
- Working environment is decent
- Work flow and processes are constantly changing and improving
- Sufficient training provided
Con:
- Shift work
- Difficulty in taking leave
- KPI driven

Title: Good environment to develop yourself
Pro:
More competitive salary in recent years. 
Good environment to develop yourself.
Con:
MIddle manager structure getting more and more complicated over the years
Good intention to become digital but need to be better in execution

Title: Summer Intern
Pro:
Friendly environment and colleagues.
HR held lots of activities such as health day, family day.
Con: Talking to my colleagues, they are sick of the red tape involved in everyday work which made them work overtime.

Title: A Very Organised Company
Pro:
Management is very organised
Good Employee Benefits
Good Salary
Efforts are appreciated
Con: Depends on your managers. If u have a good manager, you will have a work-life balance. Otherwise, you will work and work and work.

Title: Good opportunities to learn
Pro:
Opportunities to learn new technology stack
Good perks
Employee is valued
Con:
Chaos in management due to which few teams are suffering
Almost all control is with Singapore management, leading to conflicts
Heavily vendor dominated

Title: Good culture
Pro:
- Flexibility
- Amazing team 
- Very open culture
- Protective
Con: How your life will turn out to be in the bank will depend on your team manager.

Title: At your own discretion
Pro: Attractive pay scheme and lots of employee benefits to retain staff
Con: Top down structure where how much you're expected to work relates directly to which manager you're tagged to. If you're lucky you get to work smart, else pray and prepare to put in the hours for a job that can be finished in half the time.

Title: good work life balance
Pro: good work life balance, good benefits, competitive remuneration, happy to work there, would recommend someone to work there
Con: long working hours, company culture not the best, company politics, not the best workplace environment to be in, management do not provide support

Title: Overall a good place to start career with
Pro:
Flat management,
Nice boss and colleagues,
Nice company culture,
Good mobility,
Senior managements are good at listening,
Good learning opportunities
Benefit is good
Travel benefit is good
Con:
Slow at promotion
Bonus is not very good
Lower than market average title
Workload is higher than market average

Title: DBS - a great place to work!!!
Pro: #NAME?

Title: Good place to work
Pro:
Benefits are great. 
There is work life balance
CEO has a vision and clear direction  for the company
Supports employee having young children
Con:
Bosses are still rigid in their mindset and not open to the idea of working elsewhere or from home
Departments are still working very silo and little collaboration though the company is encouraging and moving towards that.

Title: Satisfactory
Pro:
Employee friendly organisation.
Rigorous controls and processes.
Not a strictly formal culture.
Work related and other trainings on a regular basis.
Con:
Slow growth opportunities. 
Ad-hoc systems of appraisal.
Lack of transparency in certain teams.

Title: Blend of East and West Cultures
Pro: Loads of clientele. Micromanagement kept to a moderate level. Entire bank has a singular purpose and clarity in its goals and objectives.
Con: Compensation is on the lower end in the industry. Technology is outdated but slowly improving.

Title: not bad
Pro: nice colleagues and bosses, quite cooperative working environment, some attempts at work life balance (but there are some exceptions)
Con: many layers of red tape.. need to clear with many people before anything gets done. top down orders make things happen

Title: Internship
Pro: Friendly & helpful colleagues who is willing to lend a hand and guide me.
Con: Often have to initiate to get tasks to work on, otherwise would be waiting for work to be allocated to me as people in the department can get busy at times..

Title: Great company.
Pro: Awesome environment, fantastic work culture, friendly colleagues, great benefits, takes good care of staff in certain departments depending on which one.
Con: Fast paced environment, systems break down rather often, may be stressful at times. Other than that, I cannot think of anything else.

Title: Good Workplace to Work
Pro:
Good Culture
Employee Friendly
Best Digital Bank in Asia
good ambiance

New Technology Stack(big data, Cloud compute)

Best office space i have ever seen
Helpful coworkers

Gym Specs reimbursment

Title: Great Place To Work!

-Overall, a wonderful place to build your career in

Title: Associate

Title: A great place to work

Title: Trainee
Pro: Good work life balance, friendly working environment, everyone is willing to teach and share insights.

Title: NICE !
Pro: Good working environment, nice workplace, kind superior, they sometimes teach us about their business. All the co-workers are friendly and welcome

Title: Negative

Title: Analyst

annual leave :14 D for first year   
pay 6% pension fund,

work timing are good 
work life balance is ok

Title: DBS Bank Review

Title: Bad senior management in ITT bu
Pro: Good bank with good vision

Title: Have a Strong Mind
Pro: Managers and Colleagues are nice. But gossip spreads like wildfire - So I don't know what to think of them now. Great benefits on paper. If you like shift work, like me - great. When you're welcomed into the company, they are upfront about how tough the job is.
Con: If you're not good with time management, cases will just pile up and you'll get new cases daily too. Depending on how you deal with stress and management, the workload will drown you. Phones ring non-stop. You're going to be told off by nasty customers almost everyday. Liaising with other business units for follow up replies is tedious. KPI updated hourly so it depends on how you take it. Every second plays into your KPI - how fast you answer the call, the actual call time, after call time, personal break (only 10 mins a day) and every second/minute that exceeds your break. Very steep learning curve, especially when you're on more splits than your seniors. If you're on chat - prepare for concurrent chats. Customers be it on chat or phone - are usually there to complain or demand for something ridiculous. When cases are escalated, managers tend to give in to them which made whatever you initially told customers REDUNDANT because you could have done it yourself but no - not according to terms and conditions. As they develop apps, campaigns and platforms frequently, there are always new issues. Turnover rate is high and with good reason - understaffed, high MC rates thus more workload for everyone else. Moving to another department is only if you've been there 2 years and are a top performer. So if your stats aren't great, it's a waste.

Con: Unable to utilise benefits/leave (subject to approval), demanding supervisors, colleagues are those who will stab you behind your back. Keeps changing policies. HR spews propaganda but in reality, working environment is not that great.

Title: Customer Service Officer at Call Center Department, 6 months plus. 0/10 Do not recommend.
Pro:
Benefits are good, 24 days AL 2 day family care leave, 30 days medical leave. 
Colleagues are very nice people, they will go extra to help out.
Con:
1. Applying for leave at the call center department is very difficult and there is an unwritten rule that it is frowned upon. Managers will write people up for even taking sick leave which is unethical and ridiculous. 

2. Most team managers  only cares about meeting their own metrices, they don't care about the well being of their reports. If you are lucky you will get assigned to a good TM, otherwise your time there will be frustrating. 

3. If you do overtime it will be compensated as off in lieu. The catch is that it is so hard to get off, you might as well give them free OT. There are people trying to utilize their off in lieu for months but their requests are rejected with dumb reasons such as not able to take post shift off for pm shifts. 

4. Same problem for the rest of your leave. Birthday time off etc. since it is next to impossible to get them. 

5. Systems are unreliable and will fail at least 2 times every month but you are expected to get on without them. The back up system is useless and you cant access  the important files in the intranet you need for references. Any mistakes that you make even when systems are down is on you and will become part of your performance report. 

6. You will deal with difficult people every day. It is what the company is paying you for. Not recommended for the faint-hearted. Get ready to spend thousands on therapy.

Title: Too much politics and marketing at Senior Level
Pro: Trainings on new technology,transport is free and good,waverock building is new
Con: Bad leaders and much of work politics, regional play,outside hyderabad people are working hard and rewards going to local people. I joined consumer banking to learn payments but learning just how to code UI and impress SG people with POC. Everything said by SG is followed by local people. Feedback is by SG managers and local managers just nod. Blindly follows SG people. Survey is filled but when I fill own I get blacklist by manager. It is better to give top score.

Title: horrible
Pro: people generally are nice. but seems standoffish due to the culture. Top management and CEO seems to have good view and values as to the direction of the bank.
Con:
most banks have many systems to toggle between for BAU. but it is my honest opinion that DBS takes the crown for the most number of system that serves at most 2 purpose each. i need 17 systems for bau.. all on a 15 inch laptop.
strong top management, weak mid management and unbalance ground staff. initiatives from top management makes sense and seems genuine in creating a good workplace and dependable bank. however, mid management either lack that foresight or are too busy in proving themselves that initiatives being cascaded down with very little effort in thoughts for the people on the ground. a team setup for a certain purpose is quickly overlooked about its objectives and overloaded due to poor management and planning. 
too many grey areas, archaic processes and systems. management too concern with pushing issues away and hover along the grey areas rather than embrace changes and acknowledge that its for the greater good to see every department as 1 bank rather than separate units.
mid management are too busy with proving themselves and giving results with no concern to staff. they take everything on and just throw it downwards with no deep understanding on how they want things to work. they only want to see the end results. when feedback on said issues, they only know how to ask for numbers and stats. extremely narrow minded.
lots of trainings and lofty ideas but none ive attended shows true reflection of management understanding what the real life is on the ground. when issues are brought up during trainings, trainers shrug and say speak to your manager. when you speak to your manager, they tell you not to get them in trouble. sure, CEO had invited people to contact him directly. but how many people are willing to disregard their livelihood and perhaps managers with good working relationships and contact the CEO directly.
